main event: A round object possibly identified as Jupiter was observed in Joplin, Missouri on 8 November 1957.
interesting points: The object appeared three times the size of a basketball,It emitted a bright white light with a red flame trailing intermittently,The sighting lasted for 1Â½ hours,The object was silent during the observation,No photographs were taken of the sighting.
sighted object: round object with bright white light
witness description: S/SGT Roks M. Mc Vee, Chief Observer at Joplin Filter Center
